input.content:
# Shell Command Groups

## Ollama Model Management
```bash
# List available models
ollama list

# Pull models
ollama pull phi

# Run models
ollama run codellama
ollama run phi
ollama run stable-code

# Remove models
ollama rm codellama:13b
ollama rm codellama:7b

# Start Ollama server
ollama serve
```

## C Compiler Project (chibicc)
```bash
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/jchidley/chibicc.git
cd chibicc/
git checkout 0522e2d77e3ab82d3b80a5be8dbbdc8d4180561c

# Build and test
make
./test.sh

# Compile manually
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./chibicc 0 > tmp.s
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./tmp

# Fix line ending issues
dos2unix ./test.sh
```

## Development Tools Setup
```bash
# Helix editor
which hx
hx main.c

# fdfind / fd (file finder)
sudo apt install fd-find
ln -s $(which fdfind) ~/.local/bin/fd

# bat (improved cat)
sudo apt install bat
ln -s $(which batcat) ~/.local/bin/bat

# Additional development tools
sudo apt install zoxide fzf ripgrep
```

## Package Management
```bash
# Update and upgrade
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo apt autoremove
sudo apt autoclean

# Install specific packages
sudo apt install wget nodejs npm -y
```

## Alpine Linux Chroot Setup
```bash
# Download and verify Alpine chroot installer
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alpinelinux/alpine-chroot-install/v0.14.0/alpine-chroot-install \
  && echo 'ccbf65f85cdc351851f8ad025bb3e65bae4d5b06  alpine-chroot-install' | sha1sum -c \
  || exit 1
chmod +x alpine-chroot-install

# Install Alpine chroot
sudo ./alpine-chroot-install
sudo ./alpine-chroot-install -p sudo

# Use Alpine chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot -u jack

# Remove Alpine chroot
/alpine/destroy --remove
```

## Claude Code CLI Installation
```bash
# Create npm global directory
mkdir ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'

# Install Claude Code CLI
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code --force --no-os-check

# Verify installation
which claude
claude
```

## SSH Setup
```bash
# Create SSH directory and copy keys
mkdir -p ~/.ssh
cp * ~/.ssh
cd .ssh
chmod 600 *
```

## Dotfile Management (chezmoi)
```bash
# Initialize chezmoi with dotfiles from repository
sh -c "$(curl -fsLS get.chezmoi.io)" -- init --apply jchidley

# Update and apply dotfiles
chezmoi update
chezmoi apply
```

file.content:
# Shell Command Groups

## Ollama Model Management
```bash
# List available models
ollama list

# Pull models
ollama pull phi

# Run models
ollama run codellama
ollama run phi
ollama run stable-code

# Remove models
ollama rm codellama:13b
ollama rm codellama:7b

# Start Ollama server
ollama serve
```

## C Compiler Project (chibicc)
```bash
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/jchidley/chibicc.git
cd chibicc/
git checkout 0522e2d77e3ab82d3b80a5be8dbbdc8d4180561c

# Build and test
make
./test.sh

# Compile manually
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./chibicc 0 > tmp.s
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./tmp

# Fix line ending issues
dos2unix ./test.sh
```

## Development Tools Setup
```bash
# Helix editor
which hx
hx main.c

# fdfind / fd (file finder)
sudo apt install fd-find
ln -s $(which fdfind) ~/.local/bin/fd

# bat (improved cat)
sudo apt install bat
ln -s $(which batcat) ~/.local/bin/bat

# Additional development tools
sudo apt install zoxide fzf ripgrep
```

## Package Management
```bash
# Update and upgrade
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo apt autoremove
sudo apt autoclean

# Install specific packages
sudo apt install wget nodejs npm -y
```

## Alpine Linux Chroot Setup
```bash
# Download and verify Alpine chroot installer
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alpinelinux/alpine-chroot-install/v0.14.0/alpine-chroot-install \
  && echo 'ccbf65f85cdc351851f8ad025bb3e65bae4d5b06  alpine-chroot-install' | sha1sum -c \
  || exit 1
chmod +x alpine-chroot-install

# Install Alpine chroot
sudo ./alpine-chroot-install
sudo ./alpine-chroot-install -p sudo

# Use Alpine chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot -u jack

# Remove Alpine chroot
/alpine/destroy --remove
```

## Claude Code CLI Installation
```bash
# Create npm global directory
mkdir ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'

# Install Claude Code CLI
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code --force --no-os-check

# Verify installation
which claude
claude
```

## SSH Setup
```bash
# Create SSH directory and copy keys
mkdir -p ~/.ssh
cp * ~/.ssh
cd .ssh
chmod 600 *
```

## Dotfile Management (chezmoi)
```bash
# Initialize chezmoi with dotfiles from repository
sh -c "$(curl -fsLS get.chezmoi.io)" -- init --apply jchidley

# Update and apply dotfiles
chezmoi update
chezmoi apply
```

# Shell Command Groups

## Ollama Model Management
```bash
# List available models
ollama list

# Pull models
ollama pull phi

# Run models
ollama run codellama
ollama run phi
ollama run stable-code

# Remove models
ollama rm codellama:13b
ollama rm codellama:7b

# Start Ollama server
ollama serve
```

## C Compiler Project (chibicc)
```bash
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/jchidley/chibicc.git
cd chibicc/
git checkout 0522e2d77e3ab82d3b80a5be8dbbdc8d4180561c

# Build and test
make
./test.sh

# Compile manually
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./chibicc 0 > tmp.s
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./tmp

# Fix line ending issues
dos2unix ./test.sh
```

## Development Tools Setup
```bash
# Helix editor
which hx
hx main.c

# fdfind / fd (file finder)
sudo apt install fd-find
ln -s $(which fdfind) ~/.local/bin/fd

# bat (improved cat)
sudo apt install bat
ln -s $(which batcat) ~/.local/bin/bat

# Additional development tools
sudo apt install zoxide fzf ripgrep
```

## Package Management
```bash
# Update and upgrade
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo apt autoremove
sudo apt autoclean

# Install specific packages
sudo apt install wget nodejs npm -y
```

## Alpine Linux Chroot Setup
```bash
# Download and verify Alpine chroot installer
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alpinelinux/alpine-chroot-install/v0.14.0/alpine-chroot-install \
  && echo 'ccbf65f85cdc351851f8ad025bb3e65bae4d5b06  alpine-chroot-install' | sha1sum -c \
  || exit 1
chmod +x alpine-chroot-install

# Install Alpine chroot
sudo ./alpine-chroot-install
sudo ./alpine-chroot-install -p sudo

# Use Alpine chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot -u jack

# Remove Alpine chroot
/alpine/destroy --remove
```

## Claude Code CLI Installation
```bash
# Create npm global directory
mkdir ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'

# Install Claude Code CLI
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code --force --no-os-check

# Verify installation
which claude
claude
```

## SSH Setup
```bash
# Create SSH directory and copy keys
mkdir -p ~/.ssh
cp * ~/.ssh
cd .ssh
chmod 600 *
```

## Dotfile Management (chezmoi)
```bash
# Initialize chezmoi with dotfiles from repository
sh -c "$(curl -fsLS get.chezmoi.io)" -- init --apply jchidley

# Update and apply dotfiles
chezmoi update
chezmoi apply
```

```bash

```bash
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/jchidley/chibicc.git
cd chibicc/
git checkout 0522e2d77e3ab82d3b80a5be8dbbdc8d4180561c

# Build and test
make
./test.sh

# Compile manually
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./chibicc 0 > tmp.s
gcc -static -o tmp tmp.s
./tmp

# Fix line ending issues
dos2unix ./test.sh
```

```bash
# Helix editor
which hx
hx main.c

sudo apt install fd-find
ln -s $(which fdfind) ~/.local/bin/fd

# bat (improved cat)
sudo apt install bat
ln -s $(which batcat) ~/.local/bin/bat

# Additional development tools
sudo apt install zoxide fzf ripgrep
```

## Package Management
```bash
# Update and upgrade
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo apt autoremove
sudo apt autoclean

# Install specific packages
sudo apt install wget nodejs npm -y
```

```bash
# Download and verify Alpine chroot installer
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alpinelinux/alpine-chroot-install/v0.14.0/alpine-chroot-install \
  && echo 'ccbf65f85cdc351851f8ad025bb3e65bae4d5b06  alpine-chroot-install' | sha1sum -c \
  || exit 1
chmod +x alpine-chroot-install

# Install Alpine chroot

sudo ./alpine-chroot-install -p sudo

/alpine/enter-chroot
/alpine/enter-chroot -u jack

```

```bash
# Create npm global directory
mkdir ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'

npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code --force --no-os-check

claude
```

mkdir -p ~/.ssh
cp * ~/.ssh
cd .ssh
chmod 600 *
```

sh -c "$(curl -fsLS get.chezmoi.io)" -- init --apply jchidley

input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Shell history tracker
# Tracks which commands from ~/.bash_history have been analyzed
# Usage: ./history-tracker.sh [check|update]

HISTORY_FILE="$HOME/.bash_history"
LAST_ANALYZED_FILE="$PWD/last_analyzed_history.txt"
HISTORY_HASH_FILE="$PWD/history_hash.md5"
COMMAND_GROUPS_FILE="$PWD/shell-command-groups.sh"

# Function to check if history has changed since last analysis
check_history_changes() {
  # Calculate current history hash
  current_hash=$(md5sum "$HISTORY_FILE" | awk '{print $1}')
  
  # If hash file doesn't exist, history has never been analyzed
  if [ ! -f "$HISTORY_HASH_FILE" ]; then
    echo "History has never been analyzed or tracking file missing."
    return 1
  fi
  
  # Compare with stored hash
  stored_hash=$(cat "$HISTORY_HASH_FILE")
  if [ "$current_hash" != "$stored_hash" ]; then
    echo "History has changed since last analysis."
    echo "Last analyzed: $(cat "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE")"
    return 1
  else
    echo "No changes detected in bash history since last analysis."
    echo "Last analyzed: $(cat "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE")"
    return 0
  fi
}

# Function to update tracking files after analysis
update_tracking() {
  # Store current datetime
  date +"Analyzed on %Y-%m-%d at %H:%M:%S" > "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE"
  
  # Calculate and store new hash
  md5sum "$HISTORY_FILE" | awk '{print $1}' > "$HISTORY_HASH_FILE"
  
  echo "Tracking information updated."
  echo "Analysis timestamp and history hash have been recorded."
}

# Function to display history stats
show_stats() {
  total_history_commands=$(wc -l < "$HISTORY_FILE")
  analyzed_commands=$(grep -v "^#" "$COMMAND_GROUPS_FILE" | grep -v "^$" | wc -l)
  
  echo "History statistics:"
  echo "- Total commands in history: $total_history_commands"
  echo "- Commands in organized groups: $analyzed_commands"
  if [ -f "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE" ]; then
    echo "- Last analyzed: $(cat "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE")"
  else
    echo "- Never fully analyzed"
  fi
}

# Main execution
case "$1" in
  check)
    check_history_changes
    ;;
  update)
    update_tracking
    ;;
  stats)
    show_stats
    ;;
  *)
    echo "Usage: $0 [check|update|stats]"
    echo "  check  - Check if bash history has changed since last analysis"
    echo "  update - Update tracking information after analysis"
    echo "  stats  - Show statistics about history and analyzed commands"
    ;;
esac

exit 0

## Repository Purpose

This repository contains tools for organizing and managing shell command history. The main functionality is:

A shell history organization tool that extracts frequently used commands from bash history, categorizes them by purpose, removes duplicates, and preserves the most successful command variants. It creates a structured shell script with command groups for various tasks including package management, development tool setup, and application configurations. The resulting script serves as both documentation and a reusable command reference, combining related commands in thematic sections with descriptive comments.

- `shell-command-groups.sh`: Contains organized command groups extracted from bash history
- `command-groups.md`: Markdown version of the command groups with descriptions

   # Read bash history
   cat ~/.bash_history

   ```

2. Save commands in an organized format:

   # Save as shell script with commented commands
   # All commands are commented for safety
   ```

## Workflow Commands

Always run these commands after making changes:
```bash
# Make shell script executable
chmod +x shell-command-groups.sh

# Validate markdown formatting

```

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Repository Purpose

This repository contains tools for organizing and managing shell command history. The main functionality is:

A shell history organization tool that extracts frequently used commands from bash history, categorizes them by purpose, removes duplicates, and preserves the most successful command variants. It creates a structured shell script with command groups for various tasks including package management, development tool setup, and application configurations. The resulting script serves as both documentation and a reusable command reference, combining related commands in thematic sections with descriptive comments.

## Files

- `shell-command-groups.sh`: Contains organized command groups extracted from bash history
- `command-groups.md`: Markdown version of the command groups with descriptions
- `history-tracker.sh`: Script to track and report on bash history analysis status
- `last_analyzed_history.txt`: Timestamp of when bash history was last analyzed
- `history_hash.md5`: MD5 hash of the bash history at last analysis

## Usage

1. Extract commands from bash history:
   ```bash
   # Read bash history
   cat ~/.bash_history
   
   # Process and organize commands
   # Commands are organized by purpose, removing redundancy
   ```

2. Save commands in an organized format:
   ```bash
   # Save as shell script with commented commands
   # All commands are commented for safety
   ```

3. Track analyzed shell history:
   ```bash
   # Check if bash history has changed since last analysis
   ./history-tracker.sh check
   
   # Update tracking information after analyzing new history
   ./history-tracker.sh update
   
   # Show statistics about history and analyzed commands
   ./history-tracker.sh stats
   ```

## History Tracking

The `history-tracker.sh` script helps you keep track of which parts of your bash history have already been analyzed:

- **Check for changes**: Compares current bash history with a stored hash to detect changes since last analysis
- **Update tracking**: Records the timestamp and hash after each analysis
- **View statistics**: Shows how many commands are in history vs. how many are in organized groups

This tracking mechanism helps ensure that:
1. You don't waste time analyzing unchanged history
2. You know exactly when the last analysis was performed
3. You can track how much of your history has been organized

## Workflow Commands

Always run these commands after making changes:
```bash
# Make shell script executable
chmod +x shell-command-groups.sh
chmod +x history-tracker.sh

# Update tracking after analyzing new history
./history-tracker.sh update

# Validate markdown formatting
# (Add specific command if needed)
```

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# Shell history tracker
# Tracks which commands from ~/.bash_history have been analyzed
# Usage: ./history-tracker.sh [check|update]

HISTORY_FILE="$HOME/.bash_history"
LAST_ANALYZED_FILE="$PWD/last_analyzed_history.txt"
HISTORY_HASH_FILE="$PWD/history_hash.md5"
COMMAND_GROUPS_FILE="$PWD/shell-command-groups.sh"

# Function to check if history has changed since last analysis
check_history_changes() {
  # Calculate current history hash
  current_hash=$(md5sum "$HISTORY_FILE" | awk '{print $1}')
  
  # If hash file doesn't exist, history has never been analyzed
  if [ ! -f "$HISTORY_HASH_FILE" ]; then
    echo "History has never been analyzed or tracking file missing."
    return 1
  fi
  
  # Compare with stored hash
  stored_hash=$(cat "$HISTORY_HASH_FILE")
  if [ "$current_hash" != "$stored_hash" ]; then
    echo "History has changed since last analysis."
    echo "Last analyzed: $(cat "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE")"
    return 1
  else
    echo "No changes detected in bash history since last analysis."
    echo "Last analyzed: $(cat "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE")"
    return 0
  fi
}

# Function to update tracking files after analysis
update_tracking() {
  # Store current datetime
  date +"Analyzed on %Y-%m-%d at %H:%M:%S" > "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE"
  
  # Calculate and store new hash
  md5sum "$HISTORY_FILE" | awk '{print $1}' > "$HISTORY_HASH_FILE"
  
  echo "Tracking information updated."
  echo "Analysis timestamp and history hash have been recorded."
}

# Function to display history stats
show_stats() {
  total_history_commands=$(wc -l < "$HISTORY_FILE")
  analyzed_commands=$(grep -v "^#" "$COMMAND_GROUPS_FILE" | grep -v "^$" | wc -l)
  
  echo "History statistics:"
  echo "- Total commands in history: $total_history_commands"
  echo "- Commands in organized groups: $analyzed_commands"
  if [ -f "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE" ]; then
    echo "- Last analyzed: $(cat "$LAST_ANALYZED_FILE")"
  else
    echo "- Never fully analyzed"
  fi
}

# Main execution
case "$1" in
  check)
    check_history_changes
    ;;
  update)
    update_tracking
    ;;
  stats)
    show_stats
    ;;
  *)
    echo "Usage: $0 [check|update|stats]"
    echo "  check  - Check if bash history has changed since last analysis"
    echo "  update - Update tracking information after analysis"
    echo "  stats  - Show statistics about history and analyzed commands"
    ;;
esac

exit 0
